app.name: Zapmail
app.description: An email client designed for sending and receiving emails with productivity features like draft stacking.

features.name: Compose and Send Email
features.description: Users can send emails by clicking the compose button, entering the recipient's address, adding a subject, and writing the message.

features.name: Stack Drafts
features.description: Users can minimize and stack their current email draft to a sidebar, allowing them to view and reference other emails while writing.

screens.name: Intro Title Screen
screens.description: A purple title screen displaying the Zapmail logo and the text 'Sending and receiving emails' with a presenter speaking.
key_elements: Title text: Sending and receiving emails

screens.name: Inbox Dashboard
screens.description: The main application interface showing a list of email threads on the left and a selected conversation view in the center.

screens.name: Compose Message Modal
screens.description: A 'New Message' pop-up window appears in the bottom right corner where the user enters recipient details and the message body.

screens.name: Draft Stacking View
screens.description: The draft message is minimized and docked to a sidebar on the right, allowing the user to browse other emails in the main view while keeping the draft accessible.

flow.flow_goal: To compose a new email, add recipients, and utilize the draft stacking feature to reference other emails simultaneously.

steps.title: Initiate New Email
steps.description: The user starts the process of creating a new email message.
steps.user_action: Click on the 'Compose' button located in the top right header.
steps.system_response: A 'New Message' pop-up window appears in the bottom right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Enter Primary Recipient
steps.description: The user specifies the primary recipient for the email.
steps.user_action: Type the recipient's email address into the 'To' field.
steps.system_response: The email address is accepted and displayed in the field.

steps.title: Add CC Recipient
steps.description: The user adds a secondary recipient to the carbon copy field.
steps.user_action: Click the 'Cc' icon on the right side of the 'To' field, then type the secondary email address.
steps.system_response: A 'Cc' input field expands below the 'To' field and populates with the typed address.

steps.title: Draft Content
steps.description: The user fills in the subject line and the body of the email.
steps.user_action: Type 'New tools' in the Subject field and begin typing the message body.
steps.system_response: Text appears in the respective fields as typed.

steps.title: Stack Draft
steps.description: The user minimizes the current draft to the side to view other content.
steps.user_action: Click the stack/minimize icon in the top right corner of the message window.
steps.system_response: The draft window shrinks and docks into a vertical sidebar on the right side of the screen.

steps.title: Reference Existing Email
steps.description: The user navigates the inbox while the draft remains accessible.
steps.user_action: Click on an existing email thread in the main list.
steps.ui_context: Main inbox view with the draft stacked in the right sidebar.
steps.system_response: The selected email thread opens in the main view area while the draft remains docked on the right.

interactions.name: Open Compose Window
interactions.rationale: The user initiates the process of creating a new email message.
interactions.description: The user clicks the 'Compose' button located in the top right corner of the interface.
interactions.system_response: A 'New Message' modal window opens in the bottom right corner.

interactions.name: Enter Recipient Email
interactions.rationale: The user specifies the primary recipient for the email.
interactions.description: The user types an email address into the 'To' field within the compose window.
interactions.system_response: The email address is populated in the field.

interactions.name: Reveal Cc Field
interactions.rationale: The user needs to copy another recipient on the email, requiring the Cc field to be visible.
interactions.description: The user clicks the 'Cc' label/button on the right side of the recipient field.
interactions.ui_context: New Message modal, right side of 'To' field
interactions.system_response: A new 'Cc' input field appears below the 'To' field.

interactions.name: Enter Cc Recipient
interactions.rationale: The user adds a secondary recipient to the email.
interactions.description: The user types an email address into the newly revealed 'Cc' field.
interactions.system_response: The secondary email address is populated.

interactions.name: Enter Subject Line
interactions.rationale: The user provides a title for the email message.
interactions.description: The user clicks into the subject line and types the subject of the email.
interactions.system_response: The text 'New tools' appears in the subject line.

interactions.name: Stack Draft
interactions.rationale: The user minimizes the current draft to view other emails in the inbox for reference.
interactions.description: The user clicks the stack/minimize icon in the header of the compose window.
interactions.ui_context: New Message modal header, top right icons
interactions.system_response: The compose window minimizes and docks into a vertical bar on the right side of the screen.

interactions.name: Browse Inbox
interactions.rationale: The user searches for information in previous emails while the draft is minimized.
interactions.description: The user scrolls down the main email list view.
interactions.system_response: The email list scrolls vertically to reveal older messages.

interactions.name: Restore Draft
interactions.rationale: The user returns to the draft to continue writing after referencing other information.
interactions.description: The user clicks the minimized draft icon in the right sidebar.
interactions.system_response: The 'New Message' modal expands back to its original size and position.
